JS390.name: Special Topics in Jewish Studies
JS390.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

JS399.name: Independent Study (W)
JS399.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
JS399.description: Advanced individual reading and research related to Jewish Studies under faculty direction.
JS399.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

JS400.name: Study Abroad in Jewish Studies (W)
JS400.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year, Summer of every year
JS400.description: Selective course offerings on sponsored Jewish Studies Programs in Israel, including the MSU Jewish Studies Summer Program at the Hebrew University and the Nature, Culture, and Environmental Issues in a Green Israel programs.
JS400.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement

JS490H.name: Honors Independent Study (W)
JS490H.semester: Fall of every year, Spring of every year
JS490H.description: Advanced honors individual reading and research related to Jewish Studies under faculty direction. Thesis.
JS490H.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
JS490H.restrictions: Not open to freshmen and open to students in the Honors College or approval of department.

JS495.name: Seminar in Jewish Studies (W)
JS495.description: Seminar on Jewish Studies topics which serves as a capstone experience for Jewish Studies minors and engages them in research projects.
JS495.prerequisite: Completion of Tier I Writing Requirement
JS495.restrictions: Not open to freshmen or sophomores.
